CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, June 26, 1943, pg. 12, reads: "Pittsburgh's Own Son Matriculates at the United States Military Academy - Having completed his studies and received his sheepskin from the University of Pittsburgh. Andrew H. McCoy, son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew McCoy, Sr. of Terrace Village, will embark upon a military career July 1 when he enters the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York.  Mr. McCoy, with a splendid character reference and scholastic background, is the first race youth to be appointed by a Pennsylvania senator.  Honors go to Senator Joseph F. Guffey of Pennsylvania who made the appointment.  Above are pictures of the future Army officer and his loved ones... In every man's life there is a woman and McCoy's interesting life is attractive Frances Anne Walcott of Philadelphia, Pa., senior at Bennett college, North Carolina, who is the object of his affections..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frances Anne Walcott seated on lawn
